newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Frantschach "confident" can buy Poland's Celuloza.
newsitem.headline: Frantschach "confident" can buy Poland's Celuloza.

text.p: Austria's largest paper maker Frantschach said on Tuesday it is confident its offer to buy Poland's Zaklady Celulozy i Papieru Celuloza SA will soon get the nod from the Polish government.
"We feel (our offer is) very strong -- we're very confident and can expect a decision within the next few days," Frantschach chief executive Gernot Strobl told Reuters.

Strobl, whose company is owned 50 percent by South Africa's Mondi Minorco Paper, declined to reveal how much the company had offered for Poland's biggest paper and cellulose producer, nor the identity of the other bidders.
Poland's treasury ministry aims to sell up to 65 percent of shares in Celuloza Swiecie to a strategic investor and float 15 percent of its shares on the Warsaw Stock Exchange this month.
Frantschach, which is unlisted, aims to finance the acquisition from the proceeds of a recent 650 million schilling nominal capital increase.
